IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Alain Locke Charter School is devoted to the betterment of urban children by improving education through identifying, improving, and implementing the best practices in education.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Alain Locke Charter School serves as a demonstration for urban schools exemplifying excellence in academics, the arts, personal and social development, and preparing students who are globally competitive. One of Chicago's first public, open enrollment charter schools, Alain Locke Charter School is one of the most successful urban charter schools in the United States. Located in the heart of Chicago's West Side, Alain Locke Charter School serves students in grades Pre-K through 8. The Charter School is a wholly owned subsidiary of Accelerate Institute.
IRS990.Desc: ALAIN LOCKE CHARTER SCHOOL (ALAIN LOCKE), NAMED FOR THE FIRST AFRICAN-AMERICAN RHODES SCHOLAR, MODELS ABSOLUTE EXCELLENCE IN CHICAGO'S HISTORICALLY UNDER SERVED EAST GARFIELD PARK NEIGHBORHOOD. WITH A LEARNER-CENTERED APPROACH AND A FOCUS ON PREPARING STUDENTS FOR A SUCCESSFUL COLLEGE EXPERIENCE, THE GOAL OF ALAIN LOCKE IS TO SERVE AS A MODEL FOR INNOVATIVE URBAN EDUCATION AND TO PRODUCE STUDENTS WHO ARE GLOBALLY COMPETITIVE. OFFERING AN EXTENDED DAY AND YEAR-ROUND PROGRAM, ALAIN LOCKE PROVIDES ELEMENTARY EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH EIGHTH GRADE. LOCATED IN EAST GARFIELD PARK ON CHICAGO'S WEST SIDE, THE STUDENTS ARE 99% AFRICAN-AMERICAN AND 1% LATINO. AT ALAIN LOCKE, MORE THAN 90% OF THE STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR FREE OR REDUCED LUNCH. ALAIN LOCKE PLACES EMPHASIS ON CHARACTER EDUCATION, ALONG WITH A POSITIVE, DISCIPLINED, AND NURTURING SCHOOL CULTURE, AND SUPPORT FOR STUDENTS IN ESTABLISHING PATTERNS OF SUCCESS AND BECOMING LIFELONG LEARNERS. TALENTED AND DEDICATED EDUCATORS ARE DRAWN TO ALAIN LOCKE BECAUSE OF ITS COMMITMENT TO PROVIDING QUALITY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AS WELL AS OPPORTUNITIES FOR LEADERSHIP AND TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH COLLEAGUES.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10 Other Income
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION - GAMING REVENUE, COLUMN A - 105.0, COLUMN B - , COLUMN C - , COLUMN D - , COLUMN E - , COLUMN F - 105.0; DESCRIPTION - GROSS SALES OF INVENTORY, COLUMN A - 2455.0, COLUMN B - 2329.0, COLUMN C - , COLUMN D - , COLUMN E - , COLUMN F - 4784.0; DESCRIPTION - OTHER EXCLUDED REVENUE, COLUMN A - 508.0, COLUMN B - 694.0, COLUMN C - 473.0, COLUMN D - 1635.0, COLUMN E - 3781.0, COLUMN F - 7091.0;

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part X, Line 2 FIN 48 (ASC 740) footnote
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Charter School is a non-profit organization and qualifies under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code for tax-exempt status. The Charter School follows accounting standards applicable to uncertain tax positions. No provision has been made for income taxes in the accompanying financial statements, as the Charter School has had no unrelated business income. Management believes the Charter School has no material unrecognized income tax benefits, including any potential loss of its tax-exempt status. The Charter School recognizes interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in interest and income tax expense, respectively. The Charter School recognized and accrued no amounts for interest or penalties as of and for the year ended June 30, 2018 or 2017. The Charter School has not been examined by any tax jurisdiction. The Charter School does not expect the total amount of unrecognized tax benefits to significantly change in the next 12 months.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 3 RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Alain Locke Charter School operates under a charter from the State of Illinois and is required to follow the Chicago Public School Lottery Guidelines. The guidelines state, with the exception of any magnet and selective enrollment schools, schools shall not exercise selective testing or erect other barriers to admission.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 6(a) FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Alain Locke Charter School receives grants and other funding from the Illinois Board of Education, the Chicago Public School District, and the City of Chicago Department of Family and Support Services.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Alain Locke High School Scholarship: Alain Locke graduates who have been admitted to tuition based high schools may qualify for an Alain Locke Scholarship on the basis of financial need, academic merit, and/or diligence in applying for other financial programs for which the student is qualified. An Alain Locke Scholarship will vary depending on the needs of the student and/or academic merit. The purpose of the scholarship is to award merit and/or to reduce, and when necessary, eliminate the financial obligation which would be incurred at a tuition based high school. Alain Locke reserves the right to determine whether the scholarship will be paid to the high school or directly to the student's parent or guardian to apply to high school expenses. Scholarship recipients must maintain at least a "C" (2.0) average to receive a scholarship renewal. The amount of a scholarship may be increased if a student demonstrates need. The scholarship program has been established to benefit students, but in no way obligates Alain Locke to provide tuition to students should there be inadequate funds available for scholarships or for any reasons other than those stated herein. Alain Locke College Scholarship: Alain Locke graduates who have been admitted to an accredited post secondary institution may qualify for a Mead Scholarship. This scholarship program shall be open to all former students who graduated from ALCS, upon graduation from high school, in the pursuit of college, technical or professional education leading to a degree. Recipients may be eligible for continued scholarship aid for each year of active enrollment until the completion of degree pursued, as determined by the Trust, but not to exceed five (5) years. Graduates qualify for a Mead Scholarship based on each applicant's demonstration of effort, dedication and prior academic success, as well as financial need. Scholarships will be awarded directly to the post-secondary institution attending to cover costs accrued on the student account.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I Explanations of reporting method for number of contributions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Food inventory - Number of contributions: Annual Amount Other - Teddy Bears and Backpacks Number of Contributions: Annual Other - Musical Band Instruments Number of Contributions: Annual

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT COMPENSATE ANY OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES. ACCORDINGLY, PER THE FORM 990 INSTRUCTIONS, THIS QUESTION HAS BEEN INTENTIONALLY MARKED "NO".

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2 Family/business relationships amongst interested persons
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PATRICK G. RYAN JR. & SHIRLEY RYAN - Family relationship

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6 Classes of members or stockholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The sole voting member of Alain Locke Charter School shall be the Accelerate Institute, a related tax-exempt Illinois organization. The following decisions will be subject to approval by a majority vote of the board of directors of Accelerate Institute, acting in its capacity as sole voting member of Alain Locke Charter School: approval of the annual budget, approval of material contracts and expenditures in an amount greater than $100,000, and the hiring/firing of the principal of Alain Locke Charter School.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b Decisions requiring approval by members or stockholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: See response to Form 990, Part VI, Line 6

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's management works with its independent third party tax preparers to complete the Form 990. Upon completion, the organization's management performs a detailed preliminary review of the prepared Form 990. Subsequent to management's preliminary review, a copy of the completed Form 990 is distributed to the full board for their review and comments prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY INCLUDES ANY DIRECTOR, ADVISORY DIRECTOR, OFFICER, OR MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH BOARD-DELEGATED POWERS WHO HAS A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL INTEREST. IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON MUST DISCLOSE THE EXISTENCE OF HIS OR HER FINANCIAL INTEREST TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND MEMBERS OF ANY COMMITTEE WITH BOARD-DELEGATED POWERS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION. CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRES ARE DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY FOR THE PURPOSE OF FACILITATING THIS DISCLOSURE. IF IT IS DETERMINED THAT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER THE ORGANIZATION CAN OBTAIN A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION WITH REASONABLE EFFORTS FROM A PERSON OR ENTITY THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IF IT IS DETERMINED THAT AN INTERESTED PERSON HAS A CONFLICT, THE ORGANIZATION TAKES ACTION TO ENSURE THAT APPROPRIATE RESTRICTIONS ARE PUT IN PLACE SUCH AS PROHIBITING THEM FROM ANY RELATED DISCUSSION, VOTE OR SIMILAR ACTION ON THE MATTER. THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE MAY, IF APPROPRIATE, APPOINT A DISINTERESTED PERSON OR COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE ALTERNATIVES TO THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION. IF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE DETERMINES THAT A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION IS NOT REASONABLY ATTAINABLE UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE BY MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DISINTERESTED DIRECTORS WHETHER THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION IS IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BEST INTERESTS AND IS FAIR AND REASONABLE TO THE ORGANIZATION, AND SHALL MAKE ITS DECISION (BY MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DISINTERESTED DIRECTORS) AS TO WHETHER TO ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION IN CONFORMITY WITH SUCH DETERMINATION. THE BOARD CHAIR AND BOARD MEMBERS MONITOR COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD UTILIZES COMPARABILITY DATA FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS IN THE INDUSTRY, AS WELL AS PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS TO DETERMINE THE COMPENSATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S PRINCIPAL. THE FINAL DETERMINATION OF THE PRINCIPAL'S COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT IS SUBJECT TO THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT BOARD'S REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE DETERMINATIONS AND DELIBERATIONS REGARDING THE PRINCIPAL'S COMPENSATION ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE CLOSED SESSION BOARD MINUTES. THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING THE PRINCIPAL'S COMPENSATION WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN JULY OF 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its conflict of interest policy, governing documents, and audited financial statements available to the public upon request.
